channel.title: Charlotte - Cheddr [hard dance synthwave]
channel.description:
Hi!
Would you be open to listening to at least most of this song and follow me as well on Spotify?
If you could help me reach my Spotify goals I would be very grateful. Please? And thank you!
https://open.spotify.com/track/1KbUrujsMmNZM4oBZo9Gpo?si=l4rEVc7aSxalsdKCmDif9w
Also I’ve been very active on twitter as well, I’m up to ove 1300 followers. I am absolutely willing to support anyone from this disco there as well. Just follow me at twitter.com/CheddrMusic (capitalization matters), send me a message saying you are from the Auxy disco with your handle here so I know who it is.
Follow @darwinmcd there too. He can tell you, it’s been great.

item.description:
Spotify

Indie Scene Artists - Friends of Cheddr, a playlist by Jeff Hines on Spotify

A playlist featuring Elephant State, Melodywhore, LYGHT, and others

Here’s a sampling ofsome of the artists we’ve met so far.

item.title: Charlotte - Cheddr [hard dance synthwave]
item.dc:creator: Cheddr
item.description:
In a nutshell my goals are

  1. To build enough momentum / critical mass on to be noticed by enough [Spotify followers/ twitter followers/ spotify algorithms / public playlist curators] to get 1000+ plays on future releases.

It takes more than 30 seconds of listening to count as a play and it takes at least that many plays to just start to get noticed before music gets suggested to others automatically by spotify to others.

It’s an experiment and a challenge. Frankly maybe even a long shot. I’ve been critical of spotify in the past. But I hadn’t really given it an honest marketing effort. If I can’t get that many plays consistently, honestly I’ll probably publish there anyway in the future but will put most of my efforts somewhere else.

Why I want to do that is related to the second goal…

  1. To meet cool independent musicians along the way and help them too. I’ve already met dozens of people that have impressed the heck out of me. Regular people with unrecognized talents because they are bedroom producers with normal jobs and families. (Whatever normal is.) They have varied goals but most of them have a creative itch and a musically outlet of some kind, and like most of us are thrilled to death when literally anyone jams out on their music.

If I don’t reach goal 1, goal 2 still makes it worthwhile.

That’s my story for now

Read full topic

item.title: Charlotte - Cheddr [hard dance synthwave]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Cheddr:

help me reach my Spotify goals

Which are…?

I’ll definitely check you and @darwinmcd out on the Twitters, to see how you’re both using it to push your music.

(I certainly need to be more pro-active.)

Read full topic

item.title: Charlotte - Cheddr [hard dance synthwave]
item.dc:creator: darwinmcd
item.description:
@Cheddr is right! I’ve made so many connections on Twitter thanks to Cheddr that I wouldn’t have otherwise. I’ve also had my songs played on 4 different radio shows that I submitted my songs to, with more coming soon. Join us on Twitter and we’ll support you. Follow me at @DarwinMcD on Twitter and I’ll follow you back.

Read full topic
